meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Skakel Faces Trial A judge found ''reasonable cause'' to believe that Michael Skakel, a nephew of Ethel Kennedy, killed a neighbor in 1975. Whether he will be tried as an adult is undecided.
Skakel Faces Trial A judge found ''reasonable cause'' to believe that Michael Skakel, a nephew of Ethel Kennedy, killed a neighbor in 1975. Whether he will be tried as an adult is undecided.
A Secret of Skin Cells Researchers believe that hair follicles are the source of new skin cells, a finding that could further the study of healing and of cancer.
Mixed Verdict in Boxing Trial The boxing figure Robert W. Lee Sr. was acquitted of racketeering but convicted on several counts.
N.F.L. Fines Ravens' Lewis Ray Lewis was fined $250,000 for lying to police about his involvement in an incident that resulted in two deaths.
